page.title: 06Farming
page.content: My dad is a sheep contractor. He dips the sheep and clips them then he scans and looks after them at lambing time. One of the farmers he works for owns large fields called "Parks." These are rented out for grazing at Â£90 to Â£120 per acre. Dad checks the parks every morning and sometimes I help him. If there is ever a sheep on its back we have to help it up because it could die in that position. Sometimes dad travels on a clipping contract and I go with him. Recently we went to Yorkshire and he clipped the sheep while I rolled the fleece. He can clip a sheep in two minutes and it takes me forty seconds to wrap a fleece. In the north of England we clip from mid May until the end of June.
